meanings.definition: Homographs: Words that are spelled the same but have different meanings and pronunciations.
meanings.sent1: Homographs can be confusing because they look alike but mean different things.
meanings.sent2: I learned about homographs in my English class last week.
meanings.sent3: The homographs at the spelling bee caused many contestants to stumble.
meanings.sent4: The homographs in the dictionary danced off the page with their unique meanings.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful pictures to help us understand homographs better.

meanings.definition: Homographs: Words that are spelled the same but have different origins and meanings.
meanings.sent1: Homographs can reveal interesting connections between languages.
meanings.sent2: The book explained the concept of homographs in a clear way.
meanings.sent3: The homographs in the storybook seemed to have secret messages hidden within them.
meanings.sent4: The homographs in the poem intertwined different cultures beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit showcased ancient homographs from various civilizations.
